required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase IV Trial of Repeated Doses of Ferumoxytol Compared to Iron Sucrose for the Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease on Hemodialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Ferumoxytol for Anemia of CKD Trial (FACT): A Phase IV, Open-Label, Multicenter Trial, With MRI Substudy, of Repeated Doses of Ferumoxytol Compared With Iron Sucrose for the Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia (IDA) in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD) Patients on Hemodialysis

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to compare the efficacy and safety of repeat doses of intravenous (IV) ferumoxytol with IV iron sucrose for the treatment of IDA in subjects with hemodialysis-dependent CKD.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 treatment periods (5 weeks per treatment period)
primary_outcome.description: Changes in the mean hemoglobin between Baseline and Week 5 for ferumoxytol and iron sucrose in each treatment period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 treatment periods (5 weeks per treatment period)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change in TSAT from TP Baseline to Week 5 for each TP

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Subjects With an Increase in Hemoglobin of ≥1.0 g/dL at Any Time From TP Baseline to Week 5 for Each TP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 treatment periods (5 weeks per treatment period)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants in each Treatment Period (TP)

clinical_study.condition: The Treatment of Iron Deficiency Anemia in Patients With Chronic Kidney Disease

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria include:
1. Males and females ≥18 years of age
2. Diagnosis of CKD
3. Subjects on dialysis must have been on dialysis for at least 3 months prior to screening
4. Female subjects of childbearing potential who are sexually active must be on an effective method of birth control for at least 1 month prior to screening and agree to remain on birth control until completion of participation in the study
Key Exclusion Criteria include:
1. History of allergy to either oral or IV iron
2. Female subjects who are pregnant or intend to become pregnant, breastfeeding, within 3 months postpartum, or have a positive serum or urine pregnancy test
3. Parenteral iron therapy within 30 days prior to screening or red blood cell (RBC)/whole blood transfusion within 14 days prior to screening or planned during the study

results_reference.citation: Macdougall IC, Strauss WE, Dahl NV, Bernard K, Li Z. Ferumoxytol for iron deficiency anemia in patients undergoing hemodialysis. The FACT randomized controlled trial . Clin Nephrol. 2019 Apr;91(4):237-245. doi: 10.5414/CN109512.

clinical_study.keyword: Iron deficiency anemia (IDA), Feraheme, ferumoxytol, chronic kidney disease (CKD), hemodialysis, magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 296 hemodialysis patients with IDA who met the entry criteria were enrolled and randomized (ferumoxytol: n=197; iron sucrose: n=99). One subject in the ferumoxytol group and 2 subjects in the iron sucrose group withdrew prior to receiving study drug, resulting in 293 total participants for analysis.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Hemoglobin Changes
outcome.description: Changes in the mean hemoglobin between Baseline and Week 5 for ferumoxytol and iron sucrose in each treatment period.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 treatment periods (5 weeks per treatment period)
outcome.population: Mean Change in Hemoglobin at Week 5 – ITT Population

measure.title: Hemoglobin Changes
measure.description: Changes in the mean hemoglobin between Baseline and Week 5 for ferumoxytol and iron sucrose in each treatment period.
measure.population: Mean Change in Hemoglobin at Week 5 – ITT Population

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The study protocol defined the margin for non-inferiority as 0.5 g/dL meaning non–inferiority would be established in a TP if the lower limit of the 95% confidence limit for the difference between ferumoxytol and iron sucrose mean change was ≥0.5 g/dL.
analysis.method_desc: Stats. of primary endpoint performed only for TP1 and TP2. 240 subjects retreated should yield 90% power to detect non-inferiority during TP2.

outcome.title: Changes in Transferrin Saturation (TSAT)
outcome.description: Mean change in TSAT from TP Baseline to Week 5 for each TP
outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 treatment periods (5 weeks per treatment period)
outcome.population: Mean Change in TSAT at Week 5 – ITT Population

measure.title: Changes in Transferrin Saturation (TSAT)
measure.description: Mean change in TSAT from TP Baseline to Week 5 for each TP
measure.population: Mean Change in TSAT at Week 5 – ITT Population

outcome.title: Proportion of Subjects With an Increase in Hemoglobin of ≥1.0 g/dL at Any Time From TP Baseline to Week 5 for Each TP
outcome.description: Number of participants in each Treatment Period (TP)
outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 treatment periods (5 weeks per treatment period)

measure.title: Proportion of Subjects With an Increase in Hemoglobin of ≥1.0 g/dL at Any Time From TP Baseline to Week 5 for Each TP
measure.description: Number of participants in each Treatment Period (TP)

reported_events.time_frame: Reported Adverse Events (AEs) include events starting on or after day 0 up to 13 months
reported_events.desc: Safety population included all patients who received any study drug.

event.sub_title: General disorders and administration site conditions

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.sub_title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
General disorders and administration site conditions

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If there is no multi-site publication within 18 months after the Study has been completed or terminated at all Study sites, and all data have been received by Sponsor, the Site, and SMO shall have the right to publish its results from the Study for non-commercial purposes, if submitted to Sponsor for review 60 days prior to submission of publication. Publication must remove all confidential information and may be delayed by up to 180 days to allow Sponsor to protect its interests.
